So what are you using to make it work as far as program

Any audio or video problems can be solved with a simple free program called "AVIcodec".
Just type it's name in google or whatever.

It tell's you what codecs the movie uses and if it's supported or unsupported by your software codecs. If unsupported, it will provide a link to download the necessary codec.

Thank you for seeding this great movie btw. ;)

Download and install the K-Lite Codec Pack, ver 2.70 comes with Media Player Classic (highly recommended, very simple third party media player) as well as all the latest audio and video codecs.  It's one install and you basically don't have to worry about codecs ever, until a newer version of the pack comes out.
http://www.codecguide.com/download_kl.htm
